intro: Delissea kealiae, commonly known as the Kāhului dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and basal rosette of leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky areas. It has small, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Delissea kealiae is considered a rare and endangered species, with limited distribution across the islands.
